title.narrative: Horn of Africa - comp. 1: IGAD - regional resilience coordination

description.narrative: This component has two sub-components, namely: (1.1) Regional support to drought resilience coordination, knowledge sharing and civil society work on natural resource governance in the drylands; and (1.2) Support to applied research and studies addressing key drylands resilience and food security issues. The first sub-component supports IGAD to effectively coordinate drought resilience work in the region in a manner that brings on board all major actors, including civil society. It is implemented through IGAD in order to contribute to its work under the Drought Resilience Platform established as the framework for coordination of the implementation of the IGAD Drought Resilience and Sustanability Initiative. Part of the support to this sub-component will establish the Regional Civil Society Drylands Governance Facility, to be managed by IGAD. The sub-component aims at improving coordination of policy processes, programmes and interventions, and sharing experiences among actors on drought resilience and drylands development in the Horn of Africa, plus improving civil society participation in the formulation and implementation of policies and strategies on natural resource governance to promote resilience in the Horn of Africa. Sub-component 1.2 supports applied research on drylands, short lessons learnt studies on key issues facing the drylands and on the associated sharing of knowledge and presentation of findings in various innovative ways in order to ensure that the evidence base for drylands development is better understood, shared and activated in the Horn of Africa. Through support in sub-component 1.1, IGAD will play a key role in disseminating the results and findings to the region.
